definition[0]: to follow or chase someone or something because you want to catch them
example[0]: Joe went after her to make sure she was unhurt.
example[1]: I can’t decide whether to go after the job or not.
definition[2]: to try to obtain something, such as a new job, a business contract etc
example[2]: Sega plans to go after the core of the video game playing market — children eight to 12 years old.
definition[3]: to take actions to punish someone who has done something wrong or illegal
example[3]: Rules are needed to go after brokers who sell unsuitable investments.
